etymology.description: 松(松) (sōng, "pine") refers to the tree species and is often associated with natural or wild environments. 茸(茸) (róng, "mushroom") is used to denote soft, downy growths or fungi such as mushrooms.
etymology.interpretation: 松茸(松茸) (sōngróng, "matsutake mushroom") refers to a type of mushroom known for growing in pine forests. The name emphasizes the natural habitat of the matsutake, which is often found among pine trees.

examples.chinese: 松茸是一种名贵的食用菌(松茸是一種名貴的食用菌)。
examples.pinyin: sōng róng shì yī zhǒng míng guì de shí yòng jūn.
examples.english: Matsutake mushroom is a prized edible fungus.

examples.chinese: 松茸在深山中生长(松茸在深山中生長)，被誉为珍稀食品(被譽為珍稀食品)。
examples.pinyin: sōng róng zài shēn shān zhōng shēng zhǎng, bèi yù wéi zhēn xī shí pǐn.
examples.english: Matsutake mushrooms grow in deep mountains and are revered as a rare delicacy.
